elements.title: St. James Theatre
elements.contents: ... that a 40-foot-tall (12 m) mural outside Broadway's St. James Theatre (pictured) was painted over due to a broken foot?

elements.title: Joseph Vallot
elements.contents: ... that in 1887, after spending three nights on the summit of Mont Blanc, scientist Joseph Vallot and his party were greeted with flowers by the mayor and all the inhabitants of Chamonix?

elements.title: VFC
elements.contents: ... that staff at the vegan food brand VFC interact with internet trolls on social media platforms to grow their online brand?

elements.title: Kenneth Kilgore
elements.contents: ... that American musician Kenneth Kilgore, who was inducted into the Oklahoma Jazz Hall of Fame, had a bridge posthumously named after him?

elements.title: re-educated as "little Danes"
elements.contents: ... that in 1951, 22 Greenlandic children were sent to foster families in Denmark to be re-educated as "little Danes"?

elements.title: Kate Foster
elements.contents: ... that Kate Foster is the British ambassador to Somalia, but there are no consular services at the embassy in Mogadishu?

elements.title: coal power in Turkey
elements.contents: ... that a billion dollars' worth of coal power in Turkey could be stranded?

elements.title: Victory! The Battle for Europe
elements.contents: ... that the play-by-mail game Victory! The Battle for Europe takes about three years to play?
